title: Kevin McKenzie (rugby union)
text:
Kevin Duncan McKenzie (born 22 January 1968, <a href="Stirling">Stirling</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>) is a former <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
McKenzie played as a <a href="Hooker%20%28rugby%20union%29">hooker</a>.
He played for <a href="Stirling%20County%20RFC">Stirling County</a>.
Provincial and professional career.
He played for <a href="Glasgow%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">Glasgow District</a> when rugby union was an amateur game.
When rugby union was professionalised, McKenzie played for <a href="Caledonia%20Reds">Caledonia Reds</a>.
The Reds were disbanded in 1998, and McKenzie then played for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>. He made his competitive debut for the professional Glasgow district on 13 September 1998, against <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a> at <a href="Easter%20Road">Easter Road</a> in the <a href="Scottish%20Inter-District%20Championship">Scottish Inter-District Championship</a>. He became <a href="List%20of%20Glasgow%20Warriors%20players">Glasgow Warrior No. 43</a>.
International career.
He was capped once for <a href="Scotland%20B%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland 'B'</a> on 9 December 1989 against Ireland 'B'.
He was capped fourteen times for <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> between 1994 and 1998, including the <a href="1995%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">1995 Rugby World Cup</a>,
His only international try was at <a href="Lansdowne%20Road">Lansdowne Road</a> against on 20 January 1996.
Family.
His brother <a href="Mark%20McKenzie%20%28rugby%20union%29">Mark McKenzie</a> also played for Glasgow District, Stirling County, Caledonia Reds and Glasgow Warriors.
